Probably my favourite puzzle game. 

To me, everything about it is perfect -- the graphics, the sounds, the music, the UI, the feel, the difficulty, the variety. 

Comes with a set of easy puzzles that you can finish in one sitting (or let your kid play them), and a set of harder ones that will last you a while, plus the optional added challenges of finding all the moon pearls and illuminating (covering) all the symbols.

32972246.review:
[h1]I’m Surprised I Did Not Find This Sooner[/h1]

[b]TL;DR[/b] 
[b]An amazing puzzle game with a modern and clean feel that will certainly steal a good amount of time away from your life.[/b]

Blockwick 2 is a game about moving blocks around until all blocks of the same color make contact with each other. Sounds easy but I assure you it's much more complicated than that. Some of the blocks are bolted down and can’t move while others are forced to move when moving a different block. This type of puzzle is not the kind that you end up getting frustrated at when you can’t solve it since the game lets you progress to the next level if you can find the hidden pear in every level. The soundtrack is very nice and goes with the game very well and can even be purchased on Bandcamp if you wish.

I found this in my discovery queue and was instantly reminded of the original Blockwick that I played on iOS a long time ago. Kieffer Bros. has another game on iOS called Aqueduct and that’s how I found out about them. Since I was very familiar with this developer I decided to give this game on steam a try and I think you should to. And if you decide you don’t love this beautiful masterpiece of a game you can always return it if you want, that is if you haven’t played it for too long.

Also really hoping that even though Aqueduct was made natively for iOS and Android I hope that the devs decide to port it over to steam.

28481473.review:
A great puzzle game about sliding block in  tight spots to group by color.

Where the old Klotski could get repetitive, Blockwick never repeats the same configuration and introduces special blocks to keep things interesting.

Each level has the chance of being solved or illuminated. Even if a level is hard, you can move to the next level if you find a hidden pearl. If you find a hard level you can at least move on and come back later.

The set of Basic levels added after the initial release is easier than the normal levels but they are still some extra fun.

Very recommended if you're the thinker type.

Small cons:

* Undo is limited to one movement. After that there's only the option to restart the level. And even then, this is not too bad since when you're stuck, trying a new fresh solution can be the best idea.
* Music is pleasant but the tracks are short and it will get repetitive. Easy to silence, of course.

28256639.review:
An extremely well polished and thought out puzzle game where the objective is to move all the coloured blocks of each colour to be adjacent to each other. Which sounds fairly simple, and it is - at first. As the levels get tighter and tighter and more, larger and strangely shaped blocks appear, and as you move on to later worlds and new types of blocks get added into the mix, again starting simple to show you how they work, then scaling up the difficulty again.

The game creates a good balance of having enough levels for each new mechanic it introduces into the game, and on the right difficulty curve, so as to avoid to much repetition, or the reverse issue (see Maze Lord) of introducing new mechanics too frequently and making too little use of them.

On top of the base gameplay there is also the nice addition of a couple of optional (achievement earning) extras of finding the pearl hidden under one of the blocks starting positions, and completing the level while sitting over 3 symbols marked on the game floor - in the early levels this isn't very much extra work, but on the complicated levels towards the end of each world it can make an already difficult puzzle fiendishly hard, but given they are optional not progression required this seems fine - it is up to you if you want to take on the extra challenge (or do it later).

My only real frustration with the game was the section with the sticky blocks, for some reason that mechanic annoyed me rather than all the rest that just felt like an extra challenge to overcome, I don't know why though.

Overall an excellent puzzle game that is easy to recommend to anyone that likes the genre.

26371772.review:
Любителям головоломок - однозначно к приобретению!

Что касательно меня. Вопросов, покупать или нет, не было. Фанат всяческих головоломок. Глянул скриншоты, совсем чуть-чуть посмотрел видео иб игре, и понял - покупаю.

Что же в итоге достанется потенциальному покупателю?
Игровой процесс закручен на расстановку в правильном порядке блоков различной формы. Механика игры напоминает легендарную и не умирающую настольную головоломку – Пятнашки.
Каждый уровень, а их в игре аж 304, заставит хорошенько подумать. Некоторые уровни проходятся за минуту, а какие-то приходится обмозговывать по 10 минут и более. Базовый уровень представлен 144 головомками, а продвинутый предложит вам еще 160.
При старте каждой головомки нам предлагают расставить в нужных местах блоки одного или разных цветов. Но. Элементарный стиль и геймплей усложняются тем, что на протяжении всех уровней, Вам нужно будет перемещать цветные блоки вокруг все более, и более, усложняющейся сетки до тех пор, пока все одноцветные блоки не соединятся. 
Затруднять решение будут различные препятствия. Такие как размеры и формы блоков, необходимость пробудки "сонных" блоков, расстановка блоков в строго определенные места, и так далее.
От уровня к уровня стратегия по поиску решения будет меняться. Потому как и сами блоки будут реформироваться. Появятся блоки-змейки, сдвоенные и строенные блоки, блоки-липучки, и другие.
Помимо решения самих головоломок в игре пресмотрен поиск скрытых объектов, так называемых "лунных жемчужин". В каждой головоломке скрыта одна единственная жемчужина, и на момент старта задания скрыта под одним из блоков. Сбор всех позволит получить соответствующую ачивку.
Подсказок в игре не предусмотрено. Что в определенной степени добавляет игре элемент хардкора.
Саундтрек в игре спокойный и расслабляющий. Не отвлекает и не напрягает, позволяет с большей вдумчивостью относится к решению предлагаемых заданий.

Всем, кто любит поломать голову над решением логических задач - Рекомендую.

24771745.review:
TL;DR at the bottom of the review

Blockwick 2 is a puzzle game with simple but aesthetically pleasing visuals where you move around various blocks to try to connect blocks that are alike in color. There are various worlds/chapters/sections, with new types of blocks introduced every so often to make the puzzles more difficult to solve.

I found, overall, that this is a challenging but entertaining puzzle game! I really enjoyed the concept and the new mechanics as they were introduced. The goals and instructions are straightforward, making it easy to see what you can do and how you can do it, but harder to actually get the blocks to the solution right away. This forces you to really think spatially to find the solution. 

I personally found that the difficulty wasn't too high. It didn't gradually increase and instead I found myself going through most of the puzzles with relative ease with one random puzzle every once in a while that would spike in difficulty, leaving me struggling to find the solution for a good long while (note that I was going for trying to illuminate each level the first time through, which means not just having all the same-color blocks touch, but also covering all the runes). It's hard to say whether that was how the game was intented to be or if there were just certain types of puzzles that I found more difficult than others. Either way, the game kept me entertained and itching to try and complete a much as I could.

I completed the game 100% in about 32 hours. The ambiant music was lovely to listen to, as it wasn't obnoxious or abrasive. However, I found that I was eventually becoming tired of the repetitive music after playing for hours and hours at a time. There are options to turn off the music and sound effects, so I ended up listening to my own music past that point. Other than those two options there is only a button to change the game from windowed mode to fullscreen. These few options work just fine for this game because there isn't really anything else that needs to be messed with. The game also has the original Blockwick "Basics," which offers even more puzzles. I felt that "Basics" was much easier so I often switched and worked on some of those puzzles when I was stuck on a more difficult one in the other section.

TL;DR Blockwick 2 is a challenging but enjoyable puzzle game with nice visuals and music that is definitely a great purchase for those interested in logical/spatial puzzle games! With both Blockwick "Basics" and Blockwick 2 in this game, there are 320+ puzzles!

24719825.review: 想方设法把彩色的砖块挪到一起。后面关卡很有创意！把砖块挪到指定的符文上我感觉像滑动拼图==。好像挺烧脑实则都是瞎移动。后面的难度真的能给人惊喜。

24533912.review:
9/10  TL;DR Impressive. The puzzles were very challenging; yet I never had to look up a LetsPlay cheater walkthrough, even though I played for the "Illuminated" achievement for perfect final configuration.

Spacial movement game. Obviously, the basic strategy is to open up degrees of freedom to allow manipulation and throughput. The solutions are tight, VERY TIGHT--the avenue is often mandatory, but there is some freedom for the less important tiles.  Several times, I got one step away from the final solution, only to realize that I must reverse half my moves to get one last piece on the other side where I had not expected the solution. Yet, the solutions can be visualized and executed with wonderful ah-ha insightful moments. "Wait! This is impossible without moving that piece around and under and through...It will NOT fit. Oh! It just may be possible." Brutal and brilliant.

(Not a spoiler): One feature is the sticky tile. The instructions do not quite make it clear that they are sticky like peanut butter not like glue; you CAN scrape the tile off on an edge.

9 chapters of 16 levels. 2 games in 1. The Original Blockwick "Basics" has just as many levels.

This is a well-done mobile port. Full screen. Alt-Tab works. No options, except to turn off sound and/or effects. Music very soothing, non abrasive.  Drag and drop with the mouse, No control problems.

23684253.review:
非常好玩！
（1）虽然该游戏的规则只是将相同颜色的色块（白色除外）连接在一起，但精良的关卡设计使得共19*16=304个关卡十分巧妙而具    有挑战性。每个关卡中都有三个符文印在底板上，若你能在达成关卡要求的同时将色块覆盖在这些符文上，那么你的关卡评价便会由“solved”升华为“illumination”，使难度大大提升（每个关卡也有一个藏于方块下的底板中的珍珠供收集）。
（2）色块的种类有很多，如粘性色块、虫（火车）形色块、共同移动的色块等等等等。有趣。
（3）你可以拖动色块在空间中自由移动，而并非只有上下左右的机械的移动。很爽很流畅。
（4）背景音乐很好听，给人一种舒适的感觉。

23515259.review:
スライドパズルゲーム。
ブロックをスライドさせて同じ色のブロックを隣接させていくパズルだ。
全304面(本編160面+Basics144面)でたっぷりと楽しむことができる。

[クリア条件]
ただクリアするだけなら全ての面は何度か試行錯誤すればクリアできる程度の難易度だ。
通常のクリアに加えてブロックを模様のあるマスに配置してクリアというIlluminationクリアがある。要するにブロック配置位置のノルマのあるクリアだ。このIlluminationクリアは一部の面が難しく非常にやりがいのあるものだ。もし実績も狙うなら、最初からIlluminationクリアでクリアしていくと良い。

[Basics]
本編と違ってギミックの少ないモードだ。難易度も低くIlluminationクリアも難しくはない。本編をクリアできる人ならサクサクとクリアしていくことができる。

シンプルなルールでボリュームが多いので毎日少しずつ解いていくには良いパズルゲームだ。特に悪い点はないが、強いて言うなら数手戻せると良かったと思う(現行では戻せるのは1手のみ、それ以上はリスタート)。パズルが好きならオススメのゲームだ。

23303594.review:
Blockwick 2 is a unity-based, candy-coloured block sliding puzzle game.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Vibrant colors and a crisp presentation
- Mixes it up by adding block behaviours, like sticky blocks, sleeping blocks, and snake blocks
- Allows you to skip challenging levels via a mini-game, finding a pearl buried in each level
- Want more challenge? Try beating the levels by matching the symbols on the blocks to their grid locations. Adds another layer of difficulty, and is completely optional
- Has a beginner series of puzzles that was added later, giving you even more for your money

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- For some, the music may be distracting. Luckily there is a mute button.
- The difficulty didn't progress smoothly. There were some dastardly puzzles in between otherwise simple ones. Not sure if this was by design.
- The tutorial is very sparse. In specific, I found that the sticky blocks had a behaviour that I only discovered by accident. It would have been nice to explain these better to avoid getting stuck (pun intended)
- Undo only goes back one step. I was forced to reset in some sleeping block stages, where it is quite possible to become trapped.

If you enjoy casual puzzle games, Blockwick 2 is a good deal. But if sliding block puzzles aren't your thing, you probably won't be won over by Blockwick 2. I found this to be an excellent way to take a break in between tasks by leaving it running in the background and solving a puzzle here and there. Walking away and coming back to it got me past some of the more challenging levels. It's also why my playtime is so exaggerated, pay it no mind.

I strongly advise picking this up on sale. As much as I support the hard work put into Blockwick, I can't say it's worth the full sticker price.

Achievement hunters: Assuming no use of a guide, may provide a fair challenge when trying to illuminate all levels. But nothing that time and persistence won't overcome. 100% is achievable.

(Review updated 7/2017 for better clarity and formatting)

23206381.review:
Blockwick 2 is one of the best puzzle games I have played. Every aspect of this game is spot on: the basic premise, the visual execution, the amount of variation, the difficulty and learning curve, the music and the sound effects. They all contribute to feeling it's fun to play the game and it's satisfying to solve the puzzles.

One very noteworthy thing about Blockwick 2 is that the game doesn't need to end if you're stumped by one particular puzzle. In each puzzle, there is a pearl hidden underneath one of the blocks. Find that pearl and click on it and you can move to the next puzzle if you want. Sometimes it's a good idea to skip a puzzle for now and move on, just to be able to focus on a different problem for a while. At the end of each chapter (= a collection of 16 puzzles) you can check the overview and go back to the puzzle(s) you skipped to complete the chapter.

When I got a bit frustrated by one or more puzzles in a chapter, I went and did something else for a while, but it never took long before I was drawn back to Blockwick 2 to give it another go. This is a rare thing for me. So yes, I certainly recommend Blockwick 2 to anyone who even remotely likes puzzle games.

22498846.review: Great Game! Cool Music, excelent puzzles

22302194.review:
Très bon jeu de réflexion! 

Beau, fluide, bande son tranquille, corsé par moment, addictif, haaaaa qu'il est bon de se lancer dans une partie de Blockwick 2 de temps en temps. 

Avec plus de 300 niveaux, ce qui est tout de même conséquent comme contenu, il y a de quoi rester scotché à son écran très trèèèèèès longtemps. 

Evidemment, au début, c'est de la rigolade, mais lorsqu'on passe la vitesse supérieure, il y a de quoi se faire des noeuds au ciboulot. Mais Blockwick 2 est tellement agréable que même si on bloque (wick.... hum... ouais c'est nul... désolé), même si on rage, on finit toujours par revenir sur le jeu et on finit par y arriver.

Un Must Have dans le genre. A rajouter à sa bibliothèque sans hésitation surtout qu'il n'est pas très cher.

22094729.review:
Blockwick is a fairly good puzzle game where you just have to move colored blocks to be next to other colored blocks, sounds easy, right?

The game starts fairly simple, with not so hard to solve puzzles that are pretty decent and start becoming more complicated as you progress through the levels, it adds more kind of blocks that do other stuff, like stick to other blocks and move with those, put other blocks "to sleep" (doesn't allow you to move them), caterpillar blocks and other kind of things, you can complete a level by just putting some blocks together, but if you want a bit more of a challenge you can put them in a way that they cover some locations on the floor marked by glyphs which will make the level "illuminated", it's up to you if you want the extra difficulty.

It took me 17 hours to complete the 160 puzzles (with collectionables and "illumination") that come with Blockwick 2 and 5 hours to complete 144 puzzles called "Basics" which are simpler and easier to solve (the game says they are ideal for children).

The game has a lot of levels to offer and it's available for a cheap price, the puzzles are interesting and some of them make you think a lot to be able to get an actual solution, the difficulty increases as you progress and makes it more challenging every time, I got the game for my girlfriend (who doesn't play games) and she seems to enjoy it :D

If you like puzzle games this is probably one that you will like a lot, highly recommended :D

22081826.review:
Sehr viel Puzzle für relativ wenig Geld!
Insgesamt 304 (!) Puzzles, 160 reguläre + 144 Basics (etwas leichter imo)

Der reguläre Teil des Spiel ist sehr abwechslungsreich und hat 10 Welten a 16 Puzzles mit jeweils neuen Techniken.
Sehr gut umgesetzt! Keine Bugs, Perfekte und einfache Steuerung.
Die einzelnen Puzzles sind auch clever designed und es gibt viele Kopfnüsse, 


Jedes Puzzle hat noch 2 zusätzliche Herausforderungen: 
- Finde die Perle (meistens leicht) 
- Platziere die Blöcke auf 3 bestimmten Stellen (teilweise schwer bis sehr schwer)

Absolute 100 % Kaufempfehlung für Puzzles Fans!

22037089.review: Very good puzzle game. Visuals are simple but nice. Puzzles are challenging but not too difficult, and you can always skip a puzzle if needed so you never really get stuck.

22029935.review:
A pretty good basic puzzle game.

Puzzles are well made, sometimes quite hard if you try to [i]fully[/i] solve (AKA illuminate) them.
The graphics are simple but clean. Nothing spectacular.
The interface feels like it's designed for mobile, but that didn't cause any problems.

It feels fairly polished, the only bug I found was a fullscreen Linux issue which is fixed in the beta.

IMHO, given it's price, 79%.

22021043.review:
Великолепная реинкарнация пятнашек!
Если вы являетесь, таким же, как я, любителем поломать голову над решением головоломок, эта игра для вас. За внешним минималистическим дизайном скрывается отличное исполнение, передвигать фишки очень приятно. Немного цифр: в игре два уровня сложности, в каждом по 10 уровней с 16 головоломками каждый, итого имеем 320 различных задач, шикарно! На каждом уровне помимо основной задачи по соединение фигур одного цвета, нужно найти лунную жемчужину, но и это не всё, особо сложным является расстановка фигур в заранее определённое место, указанное символами. Многие уровни заставят серьёзно напрячься, а некоторые поначалу вызывают чувство недоумения, кажется решения нет, но разгадка отправляет вас в нирвану:) Если основные уровни покажутся вам слишком сложными, всегда можно переключить сложность на более низкую, сам разработчик позиционирует её, для детей и медитативного времяпровождения. К слову,  для получения всех достижений, нужно будет решить  все задачи на обоих уровнях сложности. 
В заключении хочу сказать, что эта игра для меня встаёт в один ряд с другими гениальными произведениями, к коим отношу: Lyne, Quell, Cubot, Strata, Kami, Ichi и др.

22015251.review: As far as near mindless yet satisfying mouse-clicking goes - this game has it on point.  A great break from the mind-numbing nature of editing my paper or having a conversation with my wife.  Highly recco dis goon'nes.  Lastly, a shout-out to any reviewers who have more time logged into this game than me.  You all the real MVPs.

22008000.review:
Blockwick 2 is an excellent puzzle game which again proves that you can:
a) have good games on mobile
b) mobile games can translate perfectly well to the PC

The concept is simple: you need to group equi-coloured blocks together to complete a level. After completing each set of levels (16), the game introduces a new mechanic - first multiple colors, then blocks that can only move together, sticky blocks, etc. Finally, for a bigger challenge, you can seek a specific solution to each level where the position of the blocks also matters - you need to cover 3 floor symbols.

The visuals of the game are spartan but tastefully done, the music is good, and the controls are well executed - drag and drop works seamlessly on the PC, and I assume the touch controls work similarly well. Where the game really shines is the level design, though - the learning curve for each mechanic is properly cared for in the first 2-3 levels, and the remaining 13-14 challenges in the set (at least in the later sets) are generally quite good, occasionally bordering the fiendish. With 144 levels initally and then an added bonus level set, Blockwick 2 provides quality brain-teasing entertainment for many hours.

Highly recommended.

22005095.review:
本来是打折+1挂卡的.....结果发现....好好玩.....画风很艺术....BGM配合起来也很有趣.........物超所值....强烈建议打折入
PS：回到正题....卡真值钱....

21979573.review:
Я являюсь большим поклонником головоломок, но к сожалению мне очень давно не попадалось стоящих представителей в подобном жанре и игра "Blockwick 2" пришлась, как бальзам, на мою израненную тупыми инди-проектами и различными шутерами душу. 

Идея проста - двигаем различные разноцветные фигуры, пытаясь соединить фигуры одинакового цвета посредством приставления их друг к другу. Поначалу всё более чем просто, однако с продвижением вверх задача существенно усложняется, появляются более сложные фигуры, новые цвета и прочие подводные камни. Игра обладает довольно приятной атмосферой, отличное музыкальное сопровождение и не раздражающая глаз картинка. 

Чем-то напомнило знаменитую и обожаемую мной головоломку "LYNE", хотя игры схожи лишь атмосферой.
Всем любителям головоломок(в особенности поклонникам "LYNE") советую приобрести данную игру, не пожалеете.

21971522.review:
#EARLY REVIEW

A very cool relaxing puzzle game about connecting like colored blocks. Ramps up in difficulty, but never is totally (so far) insurmountable.

21947318.review: Красивая, хорошо озвученная, резвая игра - вот только по-настоящему оценить её получится только на планшетах -_- Мышью такое количество перетаскиваний осуществлять просто неудобно. Рекомендую тем, кто играет в Стиме под планшетными ОС.

21927148.review:
Excellent puzzle-game !

Le concept initial est très simple : il s'agit d'accoler selon leur couleur des blocs de formes variées - les blancs en moins, qui ne sont là que pour vous faire obstacle. A chaque monde s'y ajoutent de nouvelles mécaniques, chacune d'elles étant facile à assimiler : certains de ces blocs sont fixes, d'autres collent, voire s'endorment (il faudra alors les réveiller en les touchant avec un bloc de couleur identique) ou bien sont enchaînés les uns aux autres.

Toute l'intelligence de [b][i]Blockwick 2[/i][/b] réside dans l'équilibre parfait entre challenge et frustration. Non seulement la courbe de progression est impeccablement maîtrisée, mais, par-dessus le marché, dès que vous dénicherez la perle cachée dans chaque niveau, il vous sera possible de passer au suivant. Libre à vous, si l'envie vous prend, de vous attaquer plus tard à ceux sur lesquels vous aurez échoué.

[b][i]Blockwick 2[/i][/b] dispose de près de 300 énigmes, réparties sur deux "modes" et une petite vingtaine de mondes. Encore une fois, ils se sont montrés malins chez Kiefer Bros., en cela qu'ils ont intégré dans chacune d'elles une difficulté supplémentaire, mais facultative. Ainsi vous sera-t-il proposé d'illuminer les niveaux, ce qui consiste à les terminer en plaçant les blocs sur des glyphes disposés çà et là. Pour y parvenir, il faudra cependant redoubler de persévérance et d'ingéniosité.

En résumé, un puzzle-game très addictif, rarement frustant, qui bénéficie d'une durée de vie remarquable.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

21924292.review:
A brilliant execution of the block-pushing puzzle genre. STRONGLY recommend if you like that kind of puzzle.

I never played the (mobile only?) original, so the title and developer were unfamiliar to me, and I don't know exactly which features were already present in that first entry.

The premise is fairly simple: join like-colored blocks together in contiguous groups (white blocks are the neutral exception).

This game does something that many puzzle games (at least on Steam) often overlook: offering several different puzzle gimmicks, easing you into them, and giving you lots of different use cases for each one without getting repetitive. Each specialty block concept has a set of 16 stages dedicated to exploring how that block can function. Once you've mastered a specialty block, that block type might make an appearance in a later zone, so you'll get to see how it interacts with (or obstructs) your current block type.

Some stages feature huge blocks that are difficult to maneuver; others are claustrophic - loaded up with so many blocks that there's very little room to move; others are partitioned into multiple rooms that don't connect but must function together.

Puzzles are unlocked in sequence, but the devs have mercifully included, in every level, a hidden pearl that will allow you to skip to the next puzzle if you get stuck (though even if you don't get stuck, you might want to seek them out anyway). A puzzle is considered "solved" once all the colors are grouped, but each puzzle also has a "true" solution which requires solving the puzzle while all 3 of the floor's glyph spaces are occupied by a colored block. This is a nice added challenge for the compulsive completionists.

The "Basics" level pack has also been added in, bringing an additional 144 puzzles. Basics puzzles are less complex and don't make use of all the specialty block types (which is fine!), but they do have glyphs and pearls.

The visual style is clean and bright. The art isn't cluttered, so you're able to keep your focus on the blocks. The backgrounds are just slightly tinted, and you can differentiate between the white blocks and the "island" walls. The music is pleasant and ambient but not boring. There's a surprising number of tracks in the soundtrack, too. I wouldn't have expected a block puzzle game to have 18 different tracks. Here's [u][url=https://kiefferbros.bandcamp.com/album/blockwick-2-soundtrack]the Bandcamp page[/url][/u] for the soundtrack, if you want to hear more than what's in the demo video.

Note: I don't know if this game (as of this writing) will be accessible to colorblind players. I haven't seen any colorblindness options in the menu, and differentiating color is an absolutely integral part of every puzzle. Many of the colors appear to be roughly similar in value, so they might not be very distinguishable in greyscale.

Illumination out of ten.

21907995.review:
With its subtle cleverness, Blockwick 2 has surprised and delighted me. Yes, it is a block-sliding game. There are 9 chapters with 16 levels in each chapter and each chapter will introduce you to a new element: sticky-blocks, sleepy-blocks, etc. Also, there is two ways one can solve the puzzle: I was half way thru before I realized that you can find the solution, or, you can find the "illuminated" solution, which is usually slightly harder, this being such an addictive game for me, I immediately started again so I could get all of the Illumination Solutions.
   This is a fun, clever game, if you like puzzle games I do recommend this one. (At the time of this writing, I am beginning Chapter 9.)

21907414.review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Blockwick 2 handelt es sich um ein Puzzlespiel in dem man es schaffen muss Farbige Blöcke so zu verschieben das sie sie sich alle berühren.
Das ganze wird von Level zu Level schwerer indem es mehr Felder werden, Blöcke fixiert werden, neue Farben dazu kommen und vieles mehr.
Das Spiel enthält weit mehr als 100 Level
Als Zusatzherausforderung kann man Perlen finden oder noch zusätzlich bestimmte Symbole verbinden um einen Illuminationssieg zu erhalten

[h1]Positiv[/h1]

- Steam Achievements
- Herausfordernd
- Disign passend
- Wenn ein level zu schwer ist kann man es durch das finden einer Perle überspringen

[h1]Negativ[/h1]
- Zusatzherausforderungen zu einfach
- Spielprinzip wird mit der Zeit etwas langweilig

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Ein schönes Puzzlespiel das ein paar Stunden Spaß bringt. Nach einigen Stunden kann das SPielprinzip für einige langweilig werden aber für den aktuellen Preis kann man durchgehend ein paar Stunden Spielen

21904284.review:
じっくり腰を落ち着けて遊べるパズルゲームを探していたときにセールでこのゲームを発見、即購入。
スマホゲームによくあるブロック移動(指定されたブロックを画面外に出す奴)とはチトちがう。
基本は、色付きブロック同士を全部くっつけるとステージクリアが可能になる。
その上にもう一個頭を使うクリア方法(床の上の紋章みたいなマークにブロックを置く)があり、それで真のステージクリアとなる。

まぁとにかくFPSやらせわしないアクションなしでじっくりパズルしたい人にオススメ！

21866488.review:
Blockwick 2 is a logic game made by (yet unknown) indie studio Kieffer Bros. 

Gameplay revolves around moving differently colored blocks that, in the end, should end up connected to all blocks of the same color. Although it's already offering a good challenge on the basic principle, there are more optional objectives for those who seek bigger challenge - there is a hidden pearl in every level, that can grant you a hint in any level, and there are special marked places on the level, on which you have you connect the colored blocks if you want to feel really proud of yourself. (You can connect them anyway on the level and feel proud too, you won't just "illuminate" the level.)

Developers made a definitely great work on level design and overall game design, it feels really polished, and both relaxing and stressful, depending on your patience with harder levels and illumination. There are hundreds of levels, so don't be afraid this would be just a fun for few hours, especially if you'll want to illuminate all the levels - expect tens hours of gameplay!

Blockwick 2 is definitely a sweet puzzle game with a low price tag. There's nothing that would keep me from recommending this game, so... buy it, it's worth it!

19274543.review:
Very enjoyable block-pushing puzzle game.

There are ~300 puzzles, and one thing is obvious: while the game principle is old ("tried and true"), the designer has done everything right in this incarnation. The game starts you off with a very short tutorial even before you get to the main menu. Levels are unlocked sequentially, and you can either progress the easy way (move blocks around until you find the moon pearl), solve a puzzle by making all blocks of the same color touch (interesting when there's more than one color), or you can find and cover up 3 mysterious floor marks with your solution pattern (illumination). This can get tricky because for some reason those marks are in hard-to-reach places - I wonder why. ;-) There are also special blocks in later levels to keep things interesting, but I find that even with the not-so-special blocks, the levels are very well crafted and not boring.

The interface looks clean and never gets in the way: since you have these three levels of completing a puzzle, you tend to want to keep fiddling with it after you solve it to get the illumination, and the game lets you do that. It simply never pushes an intrusive "you're done now" window in your face, but it does let you know when you've solved it in an unmistakable way. There is no timer or move counter to bug you, you get the task done (or not) and move on. This probably plays well on smartphone screens, but it plays equally well with mouse control: the precision comes in handy when you need to funnel small objects through narrow spaces.

This game distills everything that's enjoyable about block-moving games in one colorful package. If you enjoy this kind of puzzle, there's no need to wait for a sale: Blockwick 2 is well worth its price.

[i]The game contains 160 base levels and another 144 levels from a "basics" set that is slightly easier. A more difficult DLC could be ported over if enough people buy the PC version.[/i]

19155108.review: This game is quite simple to learn but hard to master. I have greatly enjoyed this game, but it is quite mentally taxing in later levels. Still, there is a fairly simple mechanic which for a little extra effort allows you to skip too difficult levels, which you can go back to at your leisure.

18042131.review: Excellent puzzle game, it's trully a hidden gem.

17485158.review:
游戏是我在搜刮唯一擅长的解谜类型时候发现的，它那种圆乎乎的设计和靓丽的色彩一下吸引了我。看了一下视频，更确认这是一款类似【华容道】的解谜，没犹豫就加了愿望单。

昨天运气好，遇见土豪的好友一下送了我三个，所以外星人迅速破了三个大关，弄了一堆成就，华丽丽的上来写评价了。

这个游戏需要一定的逻辑能力，乱挪只会叫自己陷入网罗；开头有贴心的操作指导，可以有效避免一头雾水；在游戏中，需要将同样颜色的块挪到一起，地形和逐渐增加的块类型会成为障碍；除了目标块以外，其余地方都是干净的白色或者浅色，很清新；基础的要求对到一起就可以过关，但是如果（和我一样）有严重的强迫症，那么就请寻找块下面的金属球，还有把地面上的符号都盖住再点过关吧。

总体来讲并不怎么太难，不知到后面会怎样；俄罗斯方块一样，任何人都可以轻松玩的游戏，能快速让人集中精力。

美中不足，我听着配乐好像闹鬼一样，直接关掉用静音了；另外卡片怎么那么多张？无脑氪卡党鸭梨大啊......

16870230.review:
Highly recommended for puzzle fans and those with a logical mind.  

Move the blocks around so that all the colored ones touch, each color to it's own.  I used the mouse to click and drag the blocks.  There are 9 worlds or sections or whatever you want to call them, and in each one they introduce a new concept that makes the game harder, such as blocks that are linked and move together or sticky blocks.  

For completionists there are 2 more facets of the game other than just solving the puzzle.  1. Find all the white orbs that are hidden behind the blocks.  There is one orb in each level.  2. After you solve the puzzle try to get the blocks so that they cover the weird symbols to get illumination.  That's where it gets tough.  There are multiple ways to solve some of the levels.

The graphics are nice and colorful.

The music is whimsical but does not intrude on the game.  It's really nice background music for a puzzle game.  I like it a lot.

I've got over 7 hours so far and have just started the 7th world.

UPDATE:  Finished all the levels in all 9 worlds.  Now trying for all illumination--very difficult.  Some seem impossible.  But after getting all of the moon pearls (the white orbs hidden in every level) it revealed a secret 10th world!  This game is awesome.  One of the best puzzle games I've ever played.

UPDATE #2:  They added more puzzles, but they are easier than the other ones.  I think they were the ones in Blockwick 1 on mobile app.  Also, the price has increased since I bought the game.

16778358.review:
Die Herkunft von Blockwick 2 läßt sich nicht verleugnen. Blockwick basiert eindeutig auf dem Verschiebespiel Klotski, wobei es, im Gegensatz zu Klotski, nicht das Ziel ist, einen bestimmten großen Block zu befreien, sondern alle nichtweißen Blöcke einer Farbe so zu arrangieren, das diese eine Kette oder eine Cluster bliden.

Mir macht das Lösen der Aufgaben viel Spaß.

16775330.review: Well designed, straightforward puzzle game. Lots of variety in concepts and each of them presented in a clear manner in order. Slick and simple style, good variety of puzzles and two tiers of solution allow a player to progress or challenge themselves in each puzzle as they desire.

16747810.review:
Addicting as hell, [i]Blockwick 2[/i] is what every puzzle game should look like. 

Based on a very smooth gameplay and a very colourful graphic style, Blockwick 2 revisits the classic sliding tile puzzles with new shapes (pentaminos!) and new mechanics, such as locked blots, sleeping blocks, entanglements, and many others, with a real growing difficulty. 

A Moon Pearl is hidden in every level, allowing you to unlock the next one in case you're stuck.
There is 160 levels in total, scattered in 10 chapters (there's in fact a 11th chapter, but PSSHHT. This is a secret). 

There's also a secondary objective, in which you must beat all the levels with your blocks covering the runes makings, so you reach the "illuminated" rank. Trying to get all 160 levels illuminated will certainly keep you entertained for a good amount of hours!

The game is originally an application for smartphones (which I also recommend), but this Steam port is well done, and playing with a mouse is very pleasant - but if you've got a touchscreen computer, it's all for the best!

There's really not much to say about [i]Blockwick 2[/i]. If you enjoy relaxing, non-repetitive quality puzzle games with a hint of challenge and a very solid lenght, I can only strongly recommend it.

16728886.review:
Sliding-block puzzle has never been smoother and more relaxing than this!

Blockwick 2 is so elegant, I must say.

16726139.review: If you are looking for a fun game to test your brain and pass the time; this is it. If your looking for a game to challenge you to your limits; look no further! Blockwick 2 is a perfect blend of challenge and fun and allows players to decide for themselves how difficult the game is. If you just want to have fun and pass the time a little bit you can just find the moon pearls and solve the puzzles. I enjoyed just listening to the music and admiring the artwork while I solved the puzzles. There is also another way to play the game; now I may just be really bad at puzzle games, but I found this way to be very difficult. If you are a huge fan of puzzle games or are a completionist and want a real challenge, try illuminating all of the puzzles. By not only placing the blocks next to each other, but also lighting up the symbols on the floor you essentially 100% the level. The game is very rewarding when you finally beat a level, and seeing the cleared, illuminated chapter screens is a very satisfying sight. The duality of this game; being a fun and casual puzzle game, and being a great challenge by going for 100% completion makes it perfect for anyone to enjoy! 9.5/10

16712785.review: Blockwick is an excellent, challenging, relaxing puzzle game.  It encourages a sense of "flow" better than many games.  I really enjoy that it worked on my Thinkpad w510 touchscreen laptop in Linux.  Kudos to the devs on that.

overall 8/10 would recommend it to my puzzle amused friends.

Best Regards

38912678.review: Very nice puzzle game, many levels, good music, challenging and relaxing, thumb up for me.

38859508.review: The controls are good for mobile but just okay for trackpad. The screen transitions are painfully slow -- 1~2s each. The puzzles are good, but maybe too easy initially (and I can't skip to more advanced levels). I can't wait for harder levels so that more time is spent on thinking and less on tediously dragging the blocks with my trackpad.
